alert.note: Alert for Knox (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 6:25PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Knox County through 645 PM CDT... At 625 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodhull, or 12 miles southwest of Cambridge, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Oneida and Rio around 645 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 34 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
